name: Amaryllis
description: Amaryllis is a genus of two species of flowering bulbs – Amaryllis belladonna and Amaryllis paradisicola. These two species belong to the Amaryllidaceae family and are native to South Africa.They produce fragrant, trumpet-shaped flowers on top of tall stems. These beauties are attractive to butterflies, birds and bees, and lovely as cut flowers.
meaning: The genus name comes from the Greek “amarysso”, which means “to sparkle”.The name is derived from a poem by Virgil, in which a shepherdess named Amaryllis had unrequited love for a gardener named Alteo. She walked to his door daily for one month and pierced her own heart each day with a golden arrow. The blood from Amaryllis’ heart creates beautiful flowers along the path. The new flower was called – Amaryllis.
color_description: The flower color is usually some shade of pink and sometimes even white.
